summary: This document is an email chain from October 8, 2019, forwarding an invitation from the FBI Victim Services Division to victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The invitation, originally sent on September 27, 2019, announces two informational meetings (in Miramar, FL and New York, NY) for victims to learn about available services and meet with FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office representatives.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Briefing in Florida
events.description: A meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein hosted by the FBI Victim Services Division, FBI NY Field Office, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York at 2030 SW 145th Avenue, Miramar, FL.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Briefing in New York
events.description: A meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein hosted by the FBI Victim Services Division, FBI NY Field Office, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York at 290 Broadway, New York, NY.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively reaching out to victims of Jeffrey Epstein in late 2019 following his death.
Meetings were scheduled in both Florida and New York to provide victims with information about available services and support.
The communication indicates coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division, the FBI NY Field Office, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Victims were allowed to bring one support person to the meetings.
The document references an active investigation (Case Number: NY-3027571) but states specific details would not be provided.
